subject: Negotiation
title: Prospect Theory and Risk
description: A 60-second lesson on Prospect Theory and Risk.

hook.text: Win $900 for sure, or a 90% chance at $1,000? Most pick the sure thing â€” even when the math says don't.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky's prospect theory shows people evaluate gains and losses differently.

discovery.text: People are risk-averse with gains (take the sure thing) but risk-seeking with losses (gamble to avoid a loss).

twist.text: Framing the same deal as avoiding a loss instead of making a gain changes how people decide.

climax.text: Master framers present proposals as preventing losses â€” which motivates action twice as powerfully as gains.

punchline.text: Same deal, different frame, different decision. That's prospect theory.

quiz.question: According to prospect theory, how do people behave when facing losses?
options: They become risk-seeking to avoid the loss
